abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Chad Management of the
            Petroleum Economy Project were as follows: outcomes were
            unsatisfactory; project sustainability was unlikely;
            institutional development impact was moderate; the Bank
            performance was unsatisfactory; and the Borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: there is
            a need for a proper policy environment and a strong
            political commitment to reform; project preparation teams
            must be ready to question existing institutional
            arrangements even when they seem to benefit from the support
            of several key officials; there is a need for a
            comprehensive approach to develop institutional capacity in
            a sustainable manner; computerization of business processes
            is a complex and challenging undertaking that needs a clear
            strategy and proper planning; finally, the GEEP Project
            illustrates the need to phase policy and institutional
            changes not only for political feasibility reasons but also
            because of the limited absorptive capacity of the public
            service in most developing countries.
